Search Results

Learning

User Accounts

Manage user accounts for platform users, including activating, disabling, and deleting accounts. These are Site Admin activities.

Table of Contents

  1. Who can manage user accounts?
  2. How do I manage user accounts in the platform?
  3. What actions can I perform on user accounts?
  4. What are the components of the List of Users page?
  5. How do I activate a user account?
  6. How do I disable a user account?
  7. How do I enable a user account that's been disabled?
  8. How do I delete a user account?
  9. What user account status displays for Administrator invitations?
  10. How do I search for a user account?
  11. How do I exclude specific roles from platform access?
  12. How can I protect from vulnerability in Signup and Forgot Password scenarios?

Who can manage user accounts?

Only Site Administrators can access the Administration > Users page and manage user accounts.

Only a Site Administrator for Policy Manager can configure the user roles setting, which denies access to users with certain roles.

Back to top

How do I manage user accounts in the platform?

There are two ways to manage platform access:

  • Exclude specific roles from access: this is controlled by a setting in Policy Manager and requires installation of an add-on, SOA Software Scheduled Jobs. For more information, see How do I exclude specific roles from platform access?
  • Manage individual user accounts: the Site Admin can manage user accounts on the platform via Administration > Users, on the List of Users page. This page provides a summary listing of user account details, statistics about each user's activity on the platform, and actions that a Site Admin can take on a user account. See What actions can I perform on user accounts?

Back to top

What actions can I perform on user accounts?

The Site Admin can perform the following actions on user accounts:

  • Activate: see How do I activate a user account?
  • Disable: see How do I disable a user account?
  • Enable: see How do I enable a user account that's been disabled?
  • Delete: see How do I delete a user account?

Valid actions for a specific user account are determined by the account's current status, as shown in the table below.

If an account has this status... The site admin can perform these actions...
pending_validation Activate or Delete
registered Disable/Enable or Delete
invited Delete

Back to top

What are the components of the List of Users page?

The Administration section includes a List of Users page that allows you to manage site users. This page includes all users who have signed up to the platform, even if registration is not complete.

Some general points about this page:

  • To sort by the information in a specific column, in ascending or descending order, click the column title once or twice.
  • Search is available on the users list.

The following table provides a description of each page element.

Field Definition
Name / Email Displays the username and email address associated with a user account.
Status Displays the current status of a user account. Possible values: pending_validation, registered, or invited.
Last Login The date and time the user last logged on.
APIs The number of APIs the user is the Administrator of.
Apps The number of apps for which the user is on the app development team
Groups The number of groups the user is a member of.
Posts The number of posts the user has added to the Dashboard, App Board, or API Board.
Actions A drop-down menu displaying actions that are currently valid for a specific user account. Possible values: Activate, Disable, Enable, or Delete.

Back to top

How do I activate a user account?

When a new user signs up for the platform, the user account is automatically added to the platform and displays in the Administration > Users section with a pending_validation status. The user registration process can be completed in two ways:

  • By the user clicking the link in the notification email and completing the registration process.
  • By the Site Admin activating the account (see below).
To activate a user account:
  1. Log in as the Site Admin.
  2. Navigate to Administration > Users.
  3. On the List of Users page, find the user account you would like to activate.
  4. On the Action drop-down at the right, click Activate.
  5. At the notification message, click OK. The account status is immediately updated. Note that although the status change is immediate, there is a short delay before the information on the list is updated.

Back to top

How do I disable a user account?

The Site Admin can change the status of a user account. An account must have a status of Registered before it can be disabled.

If you disable a user account, the user trying to log in will see an error message that the account has been disabled.

Note: When you select an account action it is applied immediately to the account, but it may take up to five minutes to refresh the status in the UI.

To disable a user account:
  1. Log in as the Site Admin.
  2. Navigate to Administration > Users.
  3. On the List of Users page, find the user account you would like to disable.
  4. From the drop-down menu on the right, select Disable.
  5. At the notification message, click OK. The account status is immediately updated. Note that although the status change is immediate, there is a short delay before the information on the list is updated.

Back to top

How do I enable a user account that's been disabled?

The Site Admin can change the status of a user account. You can enable an account if it has a status of Registered and is currently disabled.

Note: When you select an account action it is applied immediately to the account, but it may take up to five minutes to refresh the status in the UI.

To enable a user account that's been disabled:
  1. Log in as the Site Admin.
  2. Navigate to Administration > Users.
  3. On the List of Users page, find the user account you would like to enable.
  4. From the drop-down menu on the right, select Enable.
  5. At the notification message, click OK. The account status is immediately updated. Note that although the status change is immediate, there is a short delay before the information on the list is updated.

Back to top

How do I delete a user account?

When a user account is deleted, the account is removed from the platform along with associated apps, APIs, posts or other artifacts.

To delete a user account:
  1. Log in as the Site Admin.
  2. Navigate to Administration > Users.
  3. On the List of Users page, find the user account you would like to delete.
  4. From the drop-down menu on the right, select Delete.
  5. At the notification message, click OK. The account status is immediately updated. Note that although the status change is immediate, there is a short delay before the information on the list is updated.

Back to top

What user account status displays for Administrator invitations?

An existing user who has received an invitation to become a platform administrator is assigned a status of invited. After the user has accepted the invitation, the status changes to registered.

Back to top

How do I search for a user account?

The Search Users text box allows you to perform a full-text search to target user accounts in the platform. Searchable entities include any data that displays in the List of Users page columns.

To perform a search in the List of Users page:
  1. Log in as the Site Admin.
  2. Navigate to Administration > Users.
  3. In the List of Users page, in the search box at the top right, enter search criteria and then click GO.
  4. Choose from the search results.

Back to top

How do I exclude specific roles from platform access?

You can exclude all users with a specific role or roles from accessing the platform, by installing an add-on and then setting values for a configuration property in Policy Manager.

To exclude specific roles from platform access:
  1. Log in to the SOA Software Admin Console and install the SOA Software Scheduled Jobs feature. For instructions, refer to the SOA Software Admin Console help.
  2. In the Admin Console, go to Configuration > Settings.
  3. In the Configuration Categories on the left, choose com.soa.atmosphere.
  4. In the right pane, find this property: atmosphere.config.userRolesDenied.
  5. Set one or more values, using comma separators as needed (additional info re valid values below). You can use Community Manager or Policy Manager roles, as shown below: 
    Site Administrator,Business Administrator, ApiAdmin, BusinessAdmin, SiteAdmin
  6. Click Apply Changes.

Valid roles for the atmosphere.config.userRolesDenied property are as follows:

  • Community Manager roles: SiteAdmin, BusinessAdmin, and ApiAdmin
  • Policy Manager roles: Log in to the Policy Manager console and then choose Workbench. On the left, select your organization, and then on the right, click the Security tab to view information about valid roles.

Back to top

How can I protect from vulnerability in Signup and Forgot Password scenarios?

If you're concerned with security, there is an extra step you can take to protect from a vulnerability in the Signup and Forgot Password scenarios that could allow a malicious user to enumerate user accounts.

There is a configuration setting that you can modify to restrict user enumeration in these scenarios:

  • Password reset
  • New account setup

The database field is ALLOW_USER_ENUM, in the BUSINESS_SECURITY_SETTINGS table. If enabled (set to com.soa.feature.enabled, or no value specified) the default behavior is in effect. If this value is set to com.soa.feature.disabled, the enhanced security behavior is activated.

The table below shows the default platform behavior and the enhanced security behavior for these two activities.

Activity Default Behavior Enhanced Security Behavior
Password Reset request, account does not exist: local user User sees message that the email address/password reset combination is invalid.
  • User sees message that an email has been sent to the email address.
  • Notification is sent to the email address given, offering signup.
Password Reset request: non-local (third-party) User User sees message that the email address is registered with third-party identity provider and therefore the password cannot be modified within the platform.
  • User sees message that an email has been sent to the email address.
  • Notification is sent to the email address given, saying that the account is third-party and the password can only be reset with the third-party provider.
Password Reset request: valid existing user account User sees message that the email was sent. User sees message that the email was sent.
Password Reset request: Invalid email address/password reset code combination User sees message: Email address does not match record. User sees message: Invalid email address/password reset code combination.
Create Account, account already exists with the specified email address: Local User User sees message that the email address is already in use.
  • User sees message stating check your email for next steps.
  • Notification is sent to the email address given, stating that an attempt was made to create an account and the account already exists. Includes reset password help.
Create Account, account already exists with the specified email address: Third-Party User User sees message that the email address is already in use.
  • User sees message stating check your email for next steps.
  • Notification is sent to the email address given, stating that an attempt was made to create an account but the account already exists as a third-party account.
Create Account, account with the provided email address does not exist Signup process proceeds as expected. Signup process proceeds as expected.
